questions: Utopia National Park hosted 30,000 elephants on Friday night. The next morning, there was a 4-hour elephant exodus out of the park, at a constant rate of 2,880 elephants/hour. Over the next 7-hour period, new elephants entered the park at a constant rate. If the final number of elephants in the park was 28,980, at what rate did the new elephants enter the park?

Step 1.content: There were 30,000 elephants in the park on Friday night, and during the 4-hour exodus, 2,880 * 4 = <<2880*4=11520>>11,520 elephants left the park.

Step 2.content: This means there were 30,000 - 11,520 = <<30000-11520=18480>>18,480 elephants in the park at the end of the exodus.

Step 3.content: During the next 7-hour period, 28,980 - 18,480 = <<28980-18480=14500>>14,500 elephants entered the park.

Step 4.content: The rate at which the new elephants entered the park was 14,500 / 7 = <<14500/7=2070>>2,070 elephants/hour. The answer is: 2,070

questions: Sally took 342 pens to her class of 44 students. If she gave 7 pens to each student, left half of the remainder in her locker, and took the rest home, how many did she take home?

questions: David is taking a data analytics course that lasts for 24 weeks. The course consists of 2 three-hour classes and 1 four-hour class each week. In addition, David must spend 4 hours each week working on small group homework assignments. How many hours will he spend on this course?

questions: Jenine can sharpen a pencil 5 times before it runs out. She needs to sharpen a pencil for every 1.5 hours of use. She already has ten pencils and needs to write for 105 hours. A new pencil costs $2. How much does she need to spend on more pencils to be able to write for 105 hours?

questions: Adam teaches 50 students a year. How many students will Adam teach in 10 years if in the first year he only teaches 40 students?

questions: James' keyboard is missing 1/7 of the consonants and two vowels. How many keys are missing in total? (Remember there are 5 vowels and 21 consonants in the alphabet.)

questions: An apple tree has three times as many apples as the number of plums on a plum tree. If Damien picks 3/5 of the fruits from the trees, calculate the total number of plums and apples remaining on the tree if there were 180 apples on the apple tree before Damien picked any of the fruits.

Step 2.content: If Damien picks 3/5 of the fruits from the trees, he picks 3/5*60= <<3/5*60=42>>42 plums.

Step 3.content: The total number of plums remaining on the plum tree is 60-42=<<60-42=18>>18 The answer is: 18

questions: April went to a concert that has two bands. 2/3 of the audience was there for the second band and 1/3 was there for the first band. 50% of the audience there for the second band is under the age of 30.
